author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Hindu Young World, in association with Thyrocare, will conduct a painting competition for students from Standards IV to here on March 13.

Students should choose any of the topics given below and send the entry for preliminary selection. Their paintings should be certified by school principal or art teacher that it is the original work of the participant.

Name, Standard, school, residential address, mobile number, and email id should be written on the backside of the painting.

The selected students will be intimated through email and they have to come to the venue with the intimation letter at their own cost on the specified date to participate in the finals.

Topics for juniors (Standards IV to VI): at the toy/pet store, gully cricket, Sunday family picnic, cleaning my street, a day at the zoo, at the circus, water birds, scenes from a village, first visit to the public library and summer activities.

Topics for seniors (Standards VII to IX): beach clean-up, camping out, new year carnival, classical/rock music concert, book fair, under water life, portraits of emotions, if dinosaurs existed today, domesticating the wild, retelling your favourite fairy tale and life without technology.

For registration and other details, log on to:www.thehindu.com/ ywpaintingand obtain unique ID.

Entries should be sent to The Hindu , Circulation Department, Raja Towers, II Floor, 49/5, Second Floor, New Bus Stand Road, Meyyanur, Salem – 636 004 before February 27. Finals will be held on March 13 in Salem.
title: Painting contest on March 13
